<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>Media analysts like to say that email newsletters allow publications like Morning Brew to form a “1-to-1 connection” with their audiences. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s easy to dismiss that as just another business cliché. But after reading your replies yesterday, it makes you realize that this 1-to-1 connection has real power—especially during times like these when we need to lean on each other. Thanks for inviting us into your inbox every day.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/01/facebook-employees-stage-virtual-walkout-protest-zuckerbergs-censorship-stance?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Facebook Employees Log Off
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="FB logs off" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTk2L2ZiX2xvZ3Nfb2ZmLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It's time to add "virtual walkout" to your list of "phrases I never used until 2020." Yesterday, some Facebook employees refused to report to work in a <a href="https://www.axios.com/facebook-employees-stage-virtual-walkout-7f28483e-d59c-4d5d-b4b7-891113b56233.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">coordinated protest</a> against CEO Mark Zuckerburg's position on the company's role as a fact checking body.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ryan Freitas, head of design for Facebook's News Feed, called out his boss in a tweet: "Mark is wrong, and I will endeavor in the loudest possible way to change his mind."</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Once again, social media has been the talk of social media after President Trump posted an identical message to <a href="https://apnews.com/8cfbd52a1e1b008b036961e3d8bfa098?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">FB and Twitter</a> on Friday that appeared to threaten violence against protestors who were looting. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Twitter responded </strong></span><span>by hiding the Tweet and labeling it as "glorifying violence," but did not take it down from the platform. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Facebook responded</strong></span><span> by doing nothing. It left the post up without any commentary. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Now Zuck's in the hot seat</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He took to Facebook to defend his position in two lengthy posts.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>On Friday, he distanced himself from the president's remarks but didn't go as far as to say he would take action. "I disagree strongly with how the President spoke about this, but I believe people should be able to see this for themselves," he wrote. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Then late on Sunday, he pledged that Facebook will donate $10 million to various racial justice groups following the killing of George Floyd—a gesture that seems to have done little to assuage his internal critics. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unlike Twitter boss Jack Dorsey, Zuckerberg has maintained the philosophy that his company should not arbitrate political speech. But this walkout from FB employees, including some senior figures, is the most credible threat to that line of thinking in years. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Tech employees have proven many times they are a <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/09/20/amazon-google-other-tech-employees-protest-support-climate-action/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">powerful force for change</a>. And FB's workers, scattered as they are, are demonstrating that even a pandemic can't stop them from mobilizing.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/01/stores-restaurants-close-due-protests?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
We’re Closed—Again
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Looted store" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTkxL2xvb3RlZF9zdG9yZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>JOHANNES EISELE/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just weeks after welcoming customers back following pandemic-induced closures, some restaurants and stores have <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/06/01/retailers-restaurants-across-us-close-their-doors-amid-protests/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closed their doors</a> again. This time, they’re worried about damage and theft. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">In the last few days...</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">From NYC’s SoHo to LA’s Grove mall, retail storefronts have been damaged and, at times, looted. Widespread riots led Philadelphia’s mayor to <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/nicholasreimann/2020/05/31/philadelphia-closes-all-retail-stores-as-looting-resumes-sunday/#7ffa179698dd?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">order all retailers</a> to close Sunday afternoon. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Chain reactions:</strong> Walmart is closing several hundred stores as a precaution. Amazon has adjusted delivery routes and operations in some areas. Adidas and Nordstrom temporarily closed all U.S. stores. Target, the subject of several widely publicized lootings, also closed or shortened hours at ~200 locations. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some retailers, including Nordstrom, Target, and Nike, have </span><span><a href="https://www.retaildive.com/news/retailers-respond-to-weekend-protests/578973/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">focused</a></span><span> their responses on the reasons behind the protest (police brutality and racial inequality) instead of damage to their stores, Retail Dive reports. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> It’s easier for national chains to swallow the costs associated with closed locations, lost merchandise, and repairs. But in some cities, smaller businesses already struggling after three months of a pandemic have suffered the bulk of the damage. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOSPITALITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/01/marriott-occupancy-recovers-china-us?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Break Out the Rewards Points
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Consultants may not have to wait long to fall back into the 400 thread-count embrace of St. Regis sheets. Arne Sorenson, CEO of parent company Marriott, said personal and business travel is picking back up in key markets. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In China, all of Marriott's hotels are open and occupancy is up to 40% from a February low of 7%. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In the U.S., its largest market, Marriott is also seeing a recovery, with occupancy back around 20%. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">More promising signs for travel:</strong> U.S. downloads of the top online travel agency apps (including Airbnb, Expedia, and Hopper) have <a href="https://blog.apptopia.com/top-us-otas-may-be-on-road-to-recovery?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">returned</a> to pre-pandemic levels, according to Apptopia. And in China, app usage for top international hotels has also rebounded.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Big picture </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Marriott said the pandemic has had a greater impact on its business "than 9/11 and the 2008 financial crisis, combined," and Sorenson doesn't expect a return to 2019's global occupancy rate of 71% for a few years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He added that predictions of a fundamentally changed industry are overblown: "I don't think it will look that much different afterwards than it did before."  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Not everyone agrees. </strong>Go deeper with our guide on how the <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/05/22/travel-pandemicera-world?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">travel industry could change</a>.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But it turns out, there’s a lot of gaps to fill in order to reach peak nutrition levels—even if you eat whole foods and take a few vitamins here and there. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That sounds pretty great and all, but how’s it taste when mixed with water? Well, we checked with our taste buds and the answer was a resounding SLURP. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Convenient, highly-absorbable, and delicious, <a href="https://www.athleticgreens.com/partner/morningbrew/?utm_campaign=morningbrew602&utm_medium=email-partner&utm_source=daily-primary&rfsn=3517928.8ad866" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Athletic Greens</a> tops you up with what your body needs to thrive.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/01/mlb-players-go-back-forth-season-line?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Diamonds Aren't Forever
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Baseball stadium" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTkzL2Jhc2ViYWxsX3N0YWRpdW0uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Unsplash</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Major League Baseball and its players' association are locked in labor discussions, and true to form, they're taking a reallllllly lonnnnng timmmme. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>You have as many wins as the Yankees right now. The 2020 MLB season has been put on hold by the coronavirus, and for more than three weeks players and owners have been <a href="https://www.cbssports.com/mlb/news/mlbpa-proposal-for-2020-mlb-season-includes-114-game-season-and-player-opt-out-per-report/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">discussing plans</a> to start it back up.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But they're getting along about as well as Bryce Harper and haircuts. In March, the two sides agreed to "discuss in good faith the economic feasibility" of playing games without fans in attendance, which seems the most realistic scenario. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The latest: </strong>Yesterday, ESPN <a href="https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/29252811/mlb-intends-propose-shorter-season-full-prorated-salaries?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> that as a last resort the league is discussing a <em>much </em>shorter season (in the neighborhood of 50 games), and paying players on a prorated salary based on the reduced number of games—the compensation structure players have been vouching for.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The two sides need to reach a deal, because a lost season would be devastating for not only millions of fans, but the long-term <a href="https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/29241941/future-mlb-not-just-2020-season-stake?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">financial health</a> of the league.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/01/dutch-court-hands-impossible-foods-victory-trademark-case?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
When You Just Can't Find the Right Words...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Sponge Bob " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=503 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3ofSBq65voKZJKrnZS/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Sponge Bob " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3ofSBq65voKZJKrnZS/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Can a veggie burger be impossible, incredible, and sensational at the same time? Kinda.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the District Court of The Hague in the Netherlands ruled that Nestlé's plant-based Incredible Burger <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/01/business/impossible-foods-nestle-incredible-burger/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">infringed</a> on the trademarks of Impossible Foods, a U.S. startup that makes the plant-based Impossible Burger. The court said Nestlé's product deliberately aimed to confuse consumers by imitating Impossible's name. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Following the decision, Nestlé hit thesaurus.com to look for an "Incredible" replacement, skipping past Amazeballs Burger to land on...Sensational Burger. It'll rebrand the product across the EU while it appeals.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To the spin room we go...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Impossible Foods </strong></span><span>characterized it as a "</span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-01/nestle-faux-burger-becomes-sensational-after-court-challenge?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">David v. Goliath</a></span><span>" decision, pitting the upstart Impossible against the world's biggest food company. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Nestlé </strong></span><span>countered, "It is our belief that anyone should be able to use descriptive terms such as 'incredible' that explain the qualities of a product."</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What’s the incredible Morning Brew's takeaway? This is a big victory for Impossible Foods as it awaits approval to enter the European market. Rival Beyond Meat is already in supermarkets there. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Flash poll: </strong>What should Nestlé have named its burger? </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We haven’t quizzed you about stock tickers recently, so like your dentist appointment, we’re way past due.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How this works:</strong> We’ll give you the letters of a company's name with its stock symbol letters <em>removed</em>. The remaining letters will be in order, and we’ll also give you the sector as a hint. One example: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Media: E T I  = Netflix (stock ticker: NFLX)</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here we goooo...</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Apparel: I</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Retail: A L A R</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Auto: E</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Fitness: E L O </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Tech: A E</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Also tech: none (stock ticker is name of company. There are multiple answers)</span></li>
</ol>
</td>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nSOCIAL MEDIA \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/01/facebook-employees-stage-virtual-walkout-protest-zuckerbergs-censorship-stance?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nFacebook Employees Log Off\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"FB logs off\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTk2L2ZiX2xvZ3Nfb2ZmLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt's time to add \"virtual walkout\" to your list of \"phrases I never used until 2020.\" Yesterday, some Facebook employees refused to report to work in a \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/facebook-employees-stage-virtual-walkout-7f28483e-d59c-4d5d-b4b7-891113b56233.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecoordinated protest\u003c/a\u003e against CEO Mark Zuckerburg's position on the company's role as a fact checking body.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRyan Freitas, head of design for Facebook's News Feed, called out his boss in a tweet: \"Mark is wrong, and I will endeavor in the loudest possible way to change his mind.\"\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Once again, social media has been the talk of social media after President Trump posted an identical message to \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/8cfbd52a1e1b008b036961e3d8bfa098?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eFB and Twitter\u003c/a\u003e on Friday that appeared to threaten violence against protestors who were looting. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTwitter responded \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eby hiding the Tweet and labeling it as \"glorifying violence,\" but did not take it down from the platform. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFacebook responded\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e by doing nothing. It left the post up without any commentary. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNow Zuck's in the hot seat\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHe took to Facebook to defend his position in two lengthy posts.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOn Friday, he distanced himself from the president's remarks but didn't go as far as to say he would take action. \"I disagree strongly with how the President spoke about this, but I believe people should be able to see this for themselves,\" he wrote. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThen late on Sunday, he pledged that Facebook will donate $10 million to various racial justice groups following the killing of George Floyd—a gesture that seems to have done little to assuage his internal critics. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUnlike Twitter boss Jack Dorsey, Zuckerberg has maintained the philosophy that his company should not arbitrate political speech. But this walkout from FB employees, including some senior figures, is the most credible threat to that line of thinking in years. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Tech employees have proven many times they are a \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/09/20/amazon-google-other-tech-employees-protest-support-climate-action/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epowerful force for change\u003c/a\u003e. And FB's workers, scattered as they are, are demonstrating that even a pandemic can't stop them from mobilizing.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F06%2F01%2Ffacebook-employees-stage-virtual-walkout-protest-zuckerbergs-censorship-stance\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 25px\" width=\"25\" src=\"https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=High+level+employees+refused+to+report+to+work\u0026url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/06/01/facebook-employees-stage-virtual-walkout-protest-zuckerbergs-censorship-stance\u0026via=MorningBrew\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xMTkxL2xvb3RlZF9zdG9yZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eJOHANNES EISELE/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eJust weeks after welcoming customers back following pandemic-induced closures, some restaurants and stores have \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/06/01/retailers-restaurants-across-us-close-their-doors-amid-protests/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclosed their doors\u003c/a\u003e again. This time, they’re worried about damage and theft. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIn the last few days...\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFrom NYC’s SoHo to LA’s Grove mall, retail storefronts have been damaged and, at times, looted. Widespread riots led Philadelphia’s mayor to \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/nicholasreimann/2020/05/31/philadelphia-closes-all-retail-stores-as-looting-resumes-sunday/#7ffa179698dd?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eorder all retailers\u003c/a\u003e to close Sunday afternoon. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eChain reactions:\u003c/strong\u003e Walmart is closing several hundred stores as a precaution. Amazon has adjusted delivery routes and operations in some areas. Adidas and Nordstrom temporarily closed all U.S. stores. Target, the subject of several widely publicized lootings, also closed or shortened hours at ~200 locations. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eSome retailers, including Nordstrom, Target, and Nike, have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.retaildive.com/news/retailers-respond-to-weekend-protests/578973/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efocused\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e their responses on the reasons behind the protest (police brutality and racial inequality) instead of damage to their stores, Retail Dive reports. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture:\u003c/strong\u003e It’s easier for national chains to swallow the costs associated with closed locations, lost merchandise, and repairs. But in some cities, smaller businesses already struggling after three months of a pandemic have suffered the bulk of the damage. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eConsultants may not have to wait long to fall back into the 400 thread-count embrace of St. Regis sheets. Arne Sorenson, CEO of parent company Marriott, said personal and business travel is picking back up in key markets. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn China, all of Marriott's hotels are open and occupancy is up to 40% from a February low of 7%. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn the U.S., its largest market, Marriott is also seeing a recovery, with occupancy back around 20%. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMore promising signs for travel:\u003c/strong\u003e U.S. downloads of the top online travel agency apps (including Airbnb, Expedia, and Hopper) have \u003ca href=\"https://blog.apptopia.com/top-us-otas-may-be-on-road-to-recovery?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereturned\u003c/a\u003e to pre-pandemic levels, according to Apptopia. And in China, app usage for top international hotels has also rebounded.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBig picture \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMarriott said the pandemic has had a greater impact on its business \"than 9/11 and the 2008 financial crisis, combined,\" and Sorenson doesn't expect a return to 2019's global occupancy rate of 71% for a few years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHe added that predictions of a style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMajor League Baseball and its players' association are locked in labor discussions, and true to form, they're taking a reallllllly lonnnnng timmmme. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eYou have as many wins as the Yankees right now. The 2020 MLB season has been put on hold by the coronavirus, and for more than three weeks players and owners have been \u003ca href=\"https://www.cbssports.com/mlb/news/mlbpa-proposal-for-2020-mlb-season-includes-114-game-season-and-player-opt-out-per-report/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ediscussing plans\u003c/a\u003e to start it back up.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut they're getting along about as well as Bryce Harper and haircuts. In March, the two sides agreed to \"discuss in good faith the economic feasibility\" of playing games without fans in attendance, which seems the most realistic scenario. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe latest: \u003c/strong\u003eYesterday, ESPN \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/29252811/mlb-intends-propose-shorter-season-full-prorated-salaries?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported\u003c/a\u003e that as a last resort the league is discussing a \u003cem\u003emuch \u003c/em\u003eshorter season (in the neighborhood of 50 games), and paying players on a prorated salary based on the reduced number of games—the compensation structure players have been vouching for.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe two sides need to reach a deal, because a lost season would be devastating for not only millions of fans, but the long-term \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/mlb/story/_/id/29241941/future-mlb-not-just-2020-season-stake?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efinancial health\u003c/a\u003e of the league.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCan a veggie burger be impossible, incredible, and sensational at the same time? Kinda.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the District Court of The Hague in the Netherlands ruled that Nestlé's plant-based Incredible Burger \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/06/01/business/impossible-foods-nestle-incredible-burger/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einfringed\u003c/a\u003e on the trademarks of Impossible Foods, a U.S. startup that makes the plant-based Impossible Burger. The court said Nestlé's product deliberately aimed to confuse consumers by imitating Impossible's name. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFollowing the decision, Nestlé hit thesaurus.com to look for an \"Incredible\" replacement, skipping past Amazeballs Burger to land on...Sensational Burger. It'll rebrand the product across the EU while it appeals.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo the spin room we go...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eImpossible Foods \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003echaracterized it as a \"\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-06-01/nestle-faux-burger-becomes-sensational-after-court-challenge?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eDavid v. Goliath\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\" decision, pitting the upstart Impossible against the world's biggest food company. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNestlé \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ecountered, \"It is our belief that anyone should be able to use descriptive terms such as 'incredible' that explain the qualities of a product.\"\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat’s the incredible Morning Brew's takeaway? This is a big victory for Impossible Foods as it awaits approval to enter the European market. Rival Beyond Meat is already in supermarkets there. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Flash poll:
